page.title: 18Trentham Childrens Games - 1
page.content: 1. May I? One child is chosen to give commands and the others form a team. The child giving the commands says something like, "John, take two hops forward." John cannot move without saying, "May I?". If he forgets he loses his turn. The first one across the line is the winner. 2. Red Rover. Two teams face each other, holding hands. In turn, each team sings, "Red Rover, Red Rover, send Peter (or any other childs name on the other team) straight over." Peter then has to run and break through the opposite line. If successful he returns to his team. If not, he joins the other team. The team with the most children at the end of the game wins. 3. Tick. One child chases and has to touch anyone he can catch. This new child now has to chase the rest.
